summary: Carcinoid tumors are a type of neuroendocrine tumor that can occur in various parts of the body, most commonly in the gastrointestinal tract and lungs. They are typically slow-growing but can spread to other parts of the body. Carcinoid syndrome is a condition associated with some carcinoid tumors that release hormones.
causes: Genetic mutations (implicit in 'What Causes Gastrointestinal Carcinoid Tumors')
risk_factors: Family history (implicit in risk factor sections)
treatments: Treatment based on extent of disease
